page_content:
![](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/_assets/3137b1a864c689786cac76b3def62dd1/Assets/img/default-banner.jpg)

# Contesting a Decision by the SAAQ

If you disagree with a decision rendered by the SAAQ in your compensation file, you can contest it.

## What you should know

If you disagree with a decision we have rendered in your compensation file, you can contest it within **a period of 60 days after the reception date of that decision**.

## Filling out the form

- ### Forms

  - [Application for Review (PDF, 125.9 KB)](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/application-review-form.pdf)

**Watch out for deadlines!**

When you receive the decision by the SAAQ, you have 60 days to file an application for review.

You may:

- download and print the [Application for Review (PDF, 125.9 KB)⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/application-review-form.pdf) form
- phone us to receive the form by mail
- pick up the form at one of our [service centres](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/find-service-outlet)

Remember to write your claim number on the form and all the documents you enclose in support of your application for review.

### Online Services

[Document submission](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/online-services/citizens/reimbursement-expenses-document-submission)

### By fax

1 866 349-2759

### By mail

Direction de la révision administrative

Société de l'assurance automobile du Québec

Case postale 19150, succursale Terminus

Québec (Québec) G1K 9C3

## Processing your application and the decision

Once you have sent your application for review and the required documents, we have a period of **90 days** to render our decision.

This deadline may be extended if you wish to submit new documents or if the review officer requests that you submit additional documents or undergo another medical examination.

### The review officer's role

The review officer will contact you or your representative within 10 business days of receiving your application for review to clarify the nature of your application and better understand your situation.

### The review officer's decision

The review officer will render a decision after analyzing the elements in your file and in accordance with the law and regulations. You or your representative will receive the decision by mail.

## Further recourse

- ### Delivery time frame

  - 90 days
- ### Documents to provide

  - Any document that can support your application for review
- ### See also

  - [Québec’s Public Automobile Insurance Plan](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/traffic-accident/public-automobile-insurance-plan?ADMCMD_prev=IGNORE)

If you disagree with the review officer's decision, you have a period of 60 days after the reception date of the decision to contest it before the [Administrative Tribunal of Québec⁠ ⁠](http://www.taq.gouv.qc.ca/en/).

Last update: August 26, 2025

- ## Other websites

  - [Office des professions du Québec⁠ ⁠](http://www.opq.gouv.qc.ca/lois-et-reglements/code-des-professions/) (in French only)
  - [Administrative Tribunal of Québec⁠ ⁠](http://www.taq.gouv.qc.ca/en/)
- ## Laws and regulations

  - [Automobile Insurance Act⁠ ⁠](http://legisquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/ShowDoc/cs/A-25)
  - [Professional Code⁠ ⁠](http://legisquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/showdoc/cs/C-26)

## Safety first, on the road and online

We are committed to protecting your personal information and privacy. That’s why, when we collect data, we follow a [Policy on Privacy](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/policies/privacy) that is responsible and transparent. By continuing to browse without modifying your preferences, you accept the use of cookies.
